page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY:ASHLEWORTH
page.content: Ashleworth Church dates from Saxon times.It is situated by the Court dated c.1460 and a magnificent{Tithe {Barn.}These buildings form a group of rare interest and charm.In the church is the{Coat of Arms }of Edward VI said to be the earliest of of it's kind in the country.Nearby,on the River Severn is an old wharf.Here is the Boat Inn. The owners of the Inn have the{ferry rights granted to their family by Charles I, in gratitude for taking him across the river when he was fleeing from the siege of Gloucester, 1651.Also not far from the church is a large timber-framed manor house,c.1460 The Village Green is surrounded by houses,including a timber-framed cottage and the school,dated 1842. Hasfield has a church dating from Saxon times.The Court and Great House date from the 16th.century.
